head.title: An Inspiring Stance By a Gay Athlete

hedline.hl1: An Inspiring Stance By a Gay Athlete

abstract.p: Kenneth Huber letter responds to Apr 30 article about Corey Johnson, gay high school football player (S)

block.p: How fortunate to have lived long enough to witness a courageous young man like Corey Johnson supported and celebrated in his own community and brought to national attention by The Times (''Icon Recast: Support for a Gay Athlete,'' April 30).

To publicly confront and shatter the stereotype image of the high school football captain by stating the truth is an act of bravery with deep and far-reaching significance, stronger than any victory or display of muscle on the gridiron.

How fortunate to have lived long enough to witness a courageous young man like Corey Johnson supported and celebrated in his own community and brought to national attention by The Times (''Icon Recast: Support for a Gay Athlete,'' April 30).

To publicly confront and shatter the stereotype image of the high school football captain by stating the truth is an act of bravery with deep and far-reaching significance, stronger than any victory or display of muscle on the gridiron.

As a teenager craving the same acceptance as the jocks, I used to cry myself to sleep for lack of understanding and compassion. Today, as a 54-year-old gay baby boomer, I can cry tears of joy and relief knowing that the captain of the team is just like I am. What a liberating revelation.
